sn56.24:4.2: “Mendicants, whatever perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas truly wake up—in the past,
sn56.24:4.4: or present—all of them truly wake up the four noble truths.
sn56.24:5.2: The noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn56.24:5.3: Whatever perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas truly wake up—in the past,
sn56.24:5.5: or present—all of them truly wake up to the four noble truths.
sn56.24:6.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
